revised_title: Late Devensian Flora and Vegetation of Britain
tldr: The article discusses the changing environmental conditions in Great Britain and Ireland during the Devensian (Last) cold stage. It analyzes the Late Devensian flora and vegetation of Britain, focusing on the period between 15,000 and 10,000 years ago. The author presents a detailed analysis of plant distributions and vegetation composition, revealing regional differences and the impact of climate changes during this period. The study provides insights into the history of the British flora and the effects of climate change on plant life.
